articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Floral Basket to Cuban Embassy
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Floral Basket to Cuban Embassy
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, Supreme Leader of the Workers' Party of Korea and the state and army of the DPRK, sent a floral basket to the Cuban embassy here on Saturday, the first anniversary of demise of Fidel Castro Ruz.
					 The floral basket was laid before a photo of Fidel Castro Ruz.

articles.title: Memorial Service for Fidel Castro Ruz Held on 1st Anniversary of His Demise
articles.content:
Memorial Service for Fidel Castro Ruz Held on 1st Anniversary of His Demise
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- A memorial service for Fidel Castro Ruz took place at the Cuban embassy in the DPRK Saturday on the occasion of the first anniversary of his demise.
					 Seen before his photo was a floral basket from Kim Jong Un, Supreme Leader of the Workers' Party of Korea and the state and the army of the DPRK.
					
					 Present at the service were Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission who is chairman of the DPRK-Cuba Solidarity Committee, Ryu Myong Son, deputy department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Army Colonel General Kim Hyong Ryong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, Ho Yong Bok, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, officials of the Ministry of External Economic Relations, the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the General Bureau for Affairs with Diplomatic Corps, and officials of the Cuban embassy here including Ambassador Jesus De Los Angeles Aise Sotolongo.
					
					 Placed before the photo of Fidel Castro Ruz were floral baskets in the name of the International Department of the WPK Central Committee, the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the Foreign Ministry and the DPRK-Cuba Solidarity Committee.
					
					 Speeches were made at the event.
					
					 The speakers said that Fidel Castro Ruz was a prominent political activist who established the first socialist system in the Western hemisphere and devoted his all to the prosperity of the country, happiness of the people, and the just cause for independence against imperialism.
					
					 They recalled that Kim Jong Un paid a condolatory visit to the Cuban embassy here last year to express deep condolences over the demise of Fidel Castro Ruz and sent a high-level condolatory delegation to Cuba.
					
					 They confirmed that the fraternal relations between the DPRK and Cuba, the tradition of bilateral friendship provided by the leaders of the preceding generations of the two countries would remain unchanged despite the flow of time and the replacement of generations.
					
					 The visitors recollected with deep emotion the life of Fidel dedicated to the victorious advance of the cause of socialism and the development of the DPRK-Cuba friendly relations.

articles.title: Ri Yong Ho Meets President of Council of State of Cuba
articles.content:
Ri Yong Ho Meets President of Council of State of Cuba
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho, on an official visit to Cuba as the head of the DPRK government delegation, on Friday met and had a talk with President of the Council of Ministers Raul Castro Ruz, president of the Council of State of Cuba, at the building of the Council of State.
					 Ri courteously conveyed the warm greetings and verbal message sent by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un to Raul Castro Ruz.
					
					 He also conveyed the message of sympathy sent by the Supreme Leader to Raul Castro Ruz on the first anniversary of demise of Fidel Castro Ruz.
					
					 There was an exchange of views over the matter of boosting the traditional ties of friendship between the two countries and international issues of mutual concern at the talks.
					
					 Present there were DPRK Ambassador to Cuba Pak Chang Yul and Cuban Foreign Minister Bruno Rodriguez Parrilla.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Inspects Thongchon Fishery Station
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Inspects Thongchon Fishery Station
 Thongchon, November 25 (KCNA) -- Premier Pak Pong Ju, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, inspected the Thongchon Fishery Station.
					 Going round various parts of the station, he encouraged its fishermen in their efforts for making big fish hauls despite the cold in winter, true to the Party's call for glorifying the history of big fish hauls.
					
					 At a consultative meeting of fishery officials chaired by him there measures were taken to make bigger fish hauls this year by staging scientific and intensive operations in a bolder manner and thus implement the Party's fishing policy.
					
					 Earlier, the premier inspected the National Dance School under construction.

articles.title: Activists in Fruit-Growing Pay Homage to Great Leaders
articles.content:
Activists in Fruit-Growing Pay Homage to Great Leaders
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The participants in the national meeting of activists in fruit-growing visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il Saturday.
					 They expressed reverence to the great leaders, looking up to their statues.
					
					 At the halls where the great leaders lie in state, the visitors made deep bows to them.
					
					 They went round rooms in which orders presented to the great leaders are on display and halls housing cars, a motor car, a boat and train coaches used by them for field guidance and foreign visits till the last moments of their revolutionary life.

articles.title: Law on Disaster Prevention, Relief and Recovery Amended in DPRK
articles.content:
Law on Disaster Prevention, Relief and Recovery Amended in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK recently amended and supplemented the law on disaster prevention, relief and recovery.
					 The law consists of six chapters and 63 articles.
					
					 The law stipulates such issues as the mission of the law, principles of relief and recovery, execution of programs for disaster prevention, relief and recovery, observation and warning of disastrous natural phenomena and preparation and supply of materials for disaster prevention, relief and recovery.

articles.title: Mongolian Guests Leave
articles.content:
Mongolian Guests Leave
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Baasankhuu Oktyabri, chairman of the Mongolia-Korea Friendship Parliamentary Group, and his party left here Saturday.

articles.title: Delegation of Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan Leaves
articles.content:
Delegation of Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan Leaves
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan led by Chairman Ri Yong Su left here Saturday after taking part in the 3rd National Conference of Social Scientists.

articles.title: New Literary Works Produced in DPRK to Inspire People
articles.content:
New Literary Works Produced in DPRK to Inspire People
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Writers across the DPRK created more than 250 literary pieces in recent one month.
					 Poems like "October and land" and "He guides us" reflect the loyalty of the Korean people to implement the behests of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il to the letter and deeply trust and follow respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un only.
					
					 A collection of poems "Forward in offensive, true to call of Party" represents the heroic spirit of the workers in Komdok who are all out in the general drive to attain the goal of mineral production set forth by the Party.
					
					 Another collection of poems "Thriving Orchard" shows the struggle of the fruit farmers who proved the validity of the Party policy in practice.
					
					 Short story "Our platoon" and poem "Pace-setter" and other works depict workers across the country making devoted efforts for the sake of the country.
					
					 Other works reflect the strong will of the Korean people to annihilate the U.S. imperialists in the spirit of the defenders of the country displayed in the 1950s when the day of a do-or-die battle comes.
					
					 The works are inspiring the servicepersons and civilians of the DPRK who are all out in the general drive for the final victory.

articles.title: Ryuwon Footwear Factory
articles.content:
Ryuwon Footwear Factory
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Amid the brisk campaign for harnessing natural energy in the DPRK, the Ryuwon Footwear Factory well-known over the country as a model and standard one in the footwear industry was recently turned into an energy-saving one.
					 The factory established a 400-kW solar-power supply system, solar water-heating system and dispersive geothermal air-conditioning system to fully ensure energy for the production and management.
					
					 The solar-power supply system consists in over 1,000 solar panels, generating control board, batteries, etc.
					
					 The solar water-heating system supplies hot water at over 50 degrees Centigrade to cultural and welfare facilities.
					
					 What attracts attention in the factory is the dispersive geothermal air-conditioning system, the heat source of which is underground water, waste water and other water resources at above 3 degrees Centigrade. The system can keep the indoor temperature at about 20 degrees Centigrade, though the outdoor temperature falls in over 20 degrees below zero.
					
					 The factory also built a soilless greenhouse where such technologies as rainwater collection, methane production based on wastes and drip irrigation were introduced into for increased vegetable production.
					
					 When visited the factory in October, respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un expressed satisfaction over its modernization.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Dismisses "Presidential Statement" at ASEM Foreign Ministers' Meeting
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Dismisses "Presidential Statement" at ASEM Foreign Ministers' Meeting
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- A "presidential statement" hurting the sacred dignity of the DPRK was adopted at the 13th ASEM foreign ministers' meeting held in Myanmar on Nov. 20-21.
					 It is just a blatant challenge to the sovereignty and dignity of the DPRK that a "presidential statement", peppered with the contents produced from serious ignorance about and biased viewpoint on the social system of the DPRK and the situation on the Korean peninsula, was adopted at the ASEM foreign ministers' meeting, a gathering of diplomatic bosses of Asia and Europe.
					
					 Not content with terming the legitimate and entirely just steps taken by the DPRK to preserve its sovereignty and rights to existence and development "threats" to the international community, the "statement" took issue with it over its non-existent "human rights abuses."
					
					 The DPRK cannot but refute the relevant contents of the "statement" clause by clause.
					
					 The U.S. brought its three nuclear aircraft carriers to the vicinity of the Korean peninsula, the world's worst hot spot, and let two B-1Bs fly above it. It is about to make another serious military provocation targeting the DPRK from Dec. 4 by bringing 12 000 troops of its naval and air forces and six F-22 stealth fighter jets to south Korea.
					
					 Peace has never settled on the peninsula due to such war drumbeats.
					
					 These facts clearly prove that the nuclear war "threat" is coming from Trump, the worst-ever gangster politician and boss of the hooligans,  and his servants, who are getting desperate to "demonize" the state and people of the DPRK, crying out for "totally destroying" it in the sacred UN arena.
					
					 However, the "statement" termed the steps taken by the DPRK for self-defense "grave threats" while keeping mum about the Trump administration keen on staging mad-cap war drills near the Korean peninsula with huge nuclear strategic assets involved.
					
					 This proves that the countries which participated in the meeting deliberately defied and distorted the reality although they clearly know who is chiefly to blame for spawning the nuclear issue on the peninsula and escalating tensions there.
					
					 Those countries claimed that the meeting "reaffirmed the will to achieve durable peace and denuclearization on the Korean peninsula by peaceful diplomatic and political methods."
					
					 However, it is the situation on the peninsula that a nuclear war may break out any moment due to the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and threat to use force against it. It is clear to even a mere child that dialogue is impossible under such situation.
					
					 The countries talked about effective and comprehensive implementation of the outrageous "sanctions resolutions" against the DPRK at the meeting although the "resolutions" are seriously problematic both in law and morality. They will never be able to escape their legal responsibility for joining the U.S. in its inhuman and outrageous sanctions racket to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 They should not say this or that about the DPRK centered on the popular masses but take issue with the U.S., the kingpin of hideous state-sponsored terrorism and human rights tundra, which strikes sovereign countries with fighter jets and tanks in broad daylight and regards the lives of the colored races as something not better than the ones of flies, talking about "supremacy of whites."
					
					 Whether others recognize it or not, the DPRK, as an actual world-class nuclear weapons state, will more dynamically advance along the road chosen by it, holding fast to its nuclear deterrent of justice, in order to put a definite end to the nuclear threats from the U.S. and to preserve peace and security of the Korean peninsula and the world.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on Wretched Plight of U.S. Facing Imminent Ruin
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on Wretched Plight of U.S. Facing Imminent Ruin
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- World media are having a field day carrying the U.S. miserable defeat in the DPRK-U.S. nuclear stand-off as special news.
					 Russian internet homepage Patrioti Moskva in an article titled "Position of the DPRK as a nuclear power" wrote that the U.S. which was boasting of its advantages in nuclear weapons is reeling after the emergence of a new nuclear power in the world, adding:
					
					 The DPRK is a small country in its territory and population.
					
					 Such a country has so far been exposed to harsh nuclear threats from the U.S. 
					
					 The world's first and biggest nuclear weapons state U.S. has deployed huge nuclear hardware and nuclear weapons in south Korea and staged all sorts of nuclear war exercises including Team Spirit and Ulji Focus Lens every year and even officially declared the DPRK as a target of a preemptive nuclear attack.
					
					 This compelled the DPRK to opt for the path of nuclear possession and the path of bolstering nuclear deterrence for self-defense.
					
					 The DPRK, which had access to nuclear weapons to terminate the U.S. nuclear threat, carried out even H-bomb test to defend the sovereignty of the country and the right to existence of the nation and guarantee the peace on the Korean peninsula and the security of the region, thus ranking itself with dignity among the world's six nuclear powers.
					
					 It would be realistic and wise for the U.S. to accept the assertion of Bandow, senior fellow at the Cato Institute in the U.S. and former special assistant to President Ronald Reagan, that the option for the U.S. has to be holding dialogue with the DPRK and withdrawing the U.S. forces from Northeast Asia.
					
					 The British newspaper Daily Star and the U.S. newspaper The Hill and other media also reported that U.S. Strategic Command Head John Hyten officially said that he would not obey Trump's order for a nuclear attack on north Korea and that lots of netizens of the U.S. supported him.
					
					 The French AFP commented that the clarification of their possible denial of the president's order for nuclear attack in breach of law by U.S. Strategic Command Head John Hyten in the wake of the former U.S. Strategic Command head has something in common with the moves of Congress to restrain the U.S. president's right to use nuclear weapons.
					
					 The former senior director of the U.S. National Security Council who is an expert on nuclear weapons and non-proliferation wrote on a website of the Carnegie Foundation for International Peace that Americans may query what does it mean when they hear that the U.S. is still not be able to intercept two north Korean missiles as they have squandered tens of billions of U.S. dollars for more than 30 years, but to our regret, the U.S. has to admit this fact.
					
					 Lots of media of the world report that "the DPRK advanced into the stage of perfecting the smaller nuclear weapons of the highest level in the world", "DPRK's H-bomb is ultra-modern nuclear warhead developed in Korean style, not by the way employed by the U.S. or Russia", and "it is able to turn such big cities of the U.S. as Eastern New York and Washington into ashes at a single shot".
					
					 As was commented by the international community, the more zealously the U.S. resorts to the anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK, the bitterer shame and destruction the "world's only superpower" will face.

articles.title: "Freedom" of Thinking Touted by Imperialists Is Hypocritical: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
"Freedom" of Thinking Touted by Imperialists Is Hypocritical: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- "Freedom" of thinking touted by the imperialists in capitalist society is a false propaganda aimed to oppose the progressive thoughts and spread bourgeois ideology and a deceptive slogan to justify the ideological and cultural poisoning of other countries, Rodong Sinmun Saturday says in an article.
					 The article goes on:
					
					 When countries allow "freedom" of thinking, touted by the imperialists, failing to see through its essence, they will face grave consequences.
					
					 It was eloquently proved by the tragic reality of the countries where socialism collapsed. Those countries neglected the ideological work, not maintaining a vigilant watch on "freedom" of thinking vociferated by the imperialists. Taking advantage of this opportunity, bourgeois ideology was spread throughout the society and reactionary propaganda and blue and corrupt films and music were introduced into those countries en masse.
					
					 Obsessed with bourgeois ideology, they praised it and longed for capitalism, asserting that "free world" was the best. Finally, socialist system collapsed in those countries.
					
					 Weakening in ideological education will bring trend of liberalization now that the imperialists are making desperate efforts to spread the reactionary bourgeois ideology.
					
					 Those countries and peoples desirous of independent development and social progress should clearly see through the hypocritical and reactionary nature of "freedom" of thinking and actively struggle against it.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Regime's Arms Buildup
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Regime's Arms Buildup
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet regime sponsored a meeting of the "committee for accelerating the defense work," where it called for "bolstering the defense capability against the north" and discussed and decided on the ways to do so. According to them, 30 Surion copters will be provided for the puppet army by the end of this year and low-altitude ground-to-air missile M-SAM's production be resumed and deployed from next year. The puppet regime also decided to purchase BMEWS (ballistic missile early warning system) from abroad and push ahead with the production and introduction of various war hardware including K-2 tanks.
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Saturday says:
					
					 The above-said moves of the puppet regime are just reckless ones of the confrontation maniacs to make up for the inferiority in its military, stunned by the tremendous might of the DPRK to firmly preserve peace on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The puppet regime terms the production and introduction of such weaponry a step for "bolstering defense capabilities" to tackle someone's "threat" and "provocation" but it is just aimed to provoke a war against the north, not for "defense".
					
					 Its moves are little short of acts of treachery to wreck peace and stability on the Korean peninsula and imperil the destiny of the Korean nation as it is a foolhardy provocation to ignite a north-targeted war at any cost by playing the role of a nuclear war servant of the U.S.
					
					 What is more dangerous is that the projected arms buildup is timed to coincide with the dangerous situation on the Korean peninsula which has reached the brink of war.
					
					 The puppet regime can never hide its true colors as an arch criminal disturbing peace and stability through frantic north-targeted war drills and arms buildup in collusion with the U.S., no matter how vociferously it talks about "threat" and "provocation" by the north.

articles.title: S. Korean Workers Launch Sit-in for Vital Rights
articles.content:
S. Korean Workers Launch Sit-in for Vital Rights
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Workers at a construction site in Phyongthaek, Kyonggi Province of south Korea, launched a sit-in at a construction company in Seoul in token of protest against the management side on Nov. 21, according to the south Korean on-line newspaper Chamsesang.
					 The management side reportedly refused to pay wages under unreasonable excuses and turned down the proposal of the workers' union for negotiations.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Serbia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Serbia
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Belgrade of Serbia on Nov. 14.
					 Marijann Kubik, international secretary of the New Yugoslav Communist Party, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee set a remembrance period from November 14 to December 17 and decided to organize political and cultural events in praise of Kim Jong Il's revolutionary career and exploits in the period.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed by the All-Russia Lenin Young Communist League on Nov. 15.
					 Podzorov, first secretary of the league, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee set a remembrance period from Nov. 15 to Dec. 24 and decided to organize political and cultural events in praise of Kim Jong Il's revolutionary career and exploits in the period.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Kyrgyzstan
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Bishkek of Kyrgyzstan on Nov. 13.
					 A. Usupbayev, chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party and chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Kyrgyzstan, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The remembrance committee decided to hold seminar and other political and cultural events on the occasion of the 6th anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Romania
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Romania
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- A Romanian national committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed on Nov. 15.
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the Nationalist Socialist Party of Romania, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee set a remembrance period from Nov. 16 to Dec. 17 and decided to organize political and cultural functions praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il in the period.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia cesto de flores a la embajada cubana
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia cesto de flores a la embajada cubana
Pyongyang, 25 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, envio el dia 25 un cesto de flores a la embajada cubana en Corea con motivo del primer aniversario de deceso de Fidel Castro Ruz.
					  El cesto fue depositado ante la foto del fallecido lider cubano.

articles.title: Tiene lugar el acto en memoria de Fidel Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Tiene lugar el acto en memoria de Fidel Castro Ruz
Pyongyang, 25 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el día 25 en la Embajada de la República de Cuba en la República Popular Democrática de Corea el acto en memoria de Fidel Castro Ruz con motivo del primer aniversario de su deceso.
					Ante la foto del fallecido líder cubano, estaba depositado el cesto de flores enviado por el Máximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un.
					
					En la ocasión estuvieron presentes el presidente del Comité de Educación y del Comité Coreano de Solidaridad con Cuba, Kim Sung Du, el subjefe de departamento del Comité Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Ryu Myong Son, el coronel general de las fuerzas terrestres, Kim Hyong Ryong, quien es viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, el vicecanciller Ho Yong Bok y los funcionarios del Ministerio de Relaciones Económicas con el Extranjero, el Comité Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y la Dirección General de Trabajo con el Cuerpo Diplomático.
					
					Además, participaron el embajador Jesús De Los Ángeles Aise Sotolongo y otros miembros de la sede diplomática cubana.
					
					Fueron depositados los cestos de flores en nombre del Departamento Internacional del CC del PTC, el Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores y el Comité Coreano de Solidaridad con Cuba.
					
					En la ocasión hubo intervenciones.
					
					Los oradores recordaron que Fidel fue ilustre activista político quien estableció el régimen socialista por primera vez en el hemisferio occidental y ofrendó todo lo suyo a la prosperidad del país, la felicidad del pueblo y la justa causa por la independencia antiimperialista.
					
					Refirieron que el Máximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un visitó el año pasado a la embajada cubana para expresar profundo pesar por el fallecimiento de Fidel Castro Ruz y envió a Cuba la delegación de condolencias de alto nivel. 
					
					Reafirmaron que aunque transcurra mucho tiempo y se cambien las generaciones, serán siempre invariables las relaciones fraternales y la tradición de amistad entre Corea y Cuba, preparadas por los líderes antecesores de ambos países.
					
					Los participantes recordaron con profunda emoción la vida de Fidel quien contribuyó al avance victorioso de la causa socialista y al desarrollo de la amistad Corea-Cuba.

articles.title: Ri Yong Ho se reune en La Habana con Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Ri Yong Ho se reune en La Habana con Raul Castro Ruz
Pyongyang, 25 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El ministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Ri Yong Ho, quien realiza una visita oficial a la Republica de Cuba al frente de la delegacion gubernamental de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, departio el dia 24 en la sede del Consejo de Estado con el presidente del CE y de Ministros de la Republica de Cuba, Raul Castro Ruz.
					  El visitante transmitio cortesmente al mandatario anfitrion el saludo cordial y mensaje oral del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un.
					
					  Igualmente, traslado las palabras de consuelo del Maximo Dirigente que se le envian al presidente cubano con motivo del primer aniversario del fallecimiento de Fidel Castro Ruz.
					
					  En la ocasion, hubo el intercambio de opiniones sobre el problema de desarrollar aun mas las tradicionales relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises y los asuntos internacionales de interes mutuo.
					
					  Participaron en el encuentro el embajador coreano en Cuba, Pak Chang Yul y el canciller cubano Bruno Rodriguez Parrilla.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju recorre la Empresa Pesquera de Thongchon
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju recorre la Empresa Pesquera de Thongchon
Thongchon, 24 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El premier Pak Pong Ju, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, averiguo en el terreno la Empresa Pesquera de Thongchon.
					El premier recorrio varios puntos de la empresa estimulando a los pescadores quienes pese a las condiciones desfavorables, crean innovaciones en la pesca invernal para cumplir el proyecto del Partido de continuar escribiendo la historia del Mar de Oro (captura en abundancia de peces).
					
					En la reunion de consulta de los funcionarios de la rama, efectuada en el terreno, se tomaron las medidas para lograr mayores exitos en la campana de pesca de este ano al impulsarla de manera cientifica e intensiva y para materializar cabalmente la politica del Partido sobre la pesqueria.
					
					Con anterioridad, Pak recorrio el campo de construccion de la Escuela Nacional de Danza donde discutio los problemas presentados en esta obra.
